data.title: CodinGame Puzzle Search
data.solution:
import sys
import math

count = 0

keyword = str(input())
n = int(input())

for i in range(n):
    puzzle_info = input()
    
    name, difficulty, tags, = map(str, puzzle_info.split(" "))

    # Simple enough, if the keyword appears anywhere in name, difficulty or tags, then output the name.
    if keyword in name or keyword in difficulty or keyword in tags:
        print(name.replace("_"," "))
        count+=1
    else:
        pass

if count == 0:
    print("NO RESULTS MATCH THIS SEARCH.")
else:
    pass


# Here is a condensed version of the above code:
'''
c=0
k=input()
n=int(input())
for i in range(n):
 t,d,t=map(str,input().split(" "))
 if k in t or k in d or k in t:
  print(t.replace("_"," "));c+=1
if c==0:print("NO RESULTS MATCH THIS SEARCH.")
'''
data.statement:
You have taken inspiration from a fellow CodinGamer's work (See Background at bottom of the statement) and want to contribute in a similar manner.

You will be given [[n]] lines of strings, [[puzzle_info]], that are in the CodinGame Puzzle database.

Each [[puzzle_info]] consists of three space-separated elements which follow this format:
```
[[puzzle_info]] = "[[name]] [[difficulty]] [[tags]]"
```
Any white-spaces in [[name]], will be represented by <<underscores {{_}}>>.
There can be multiple tags in [[tags]]... if this is the case then they will be separated by <<slashes {{/}}>>.
<<All three elements will have a value, there will never be a blank value in [[puzzle_info]].>>

You will also be given a search-word, [[keyword]]. You must find any relevant puzzles that <<include>> [[keyword]] somewhere in [[puzzle_info]], and <<output their names in the order they appeared, with the underscores changed to white-spaces>>. The [[keyword]] is <<case-sensitive>>.

<<If there are no puzzles that match the [[keyword]], then you must output "{{NO RESULTS MATCH THIS SEARCH.}}">>.


<<EXAMPLE:>>
```
[[n]] = 3
[[keyword]] = "<<Conditions>>"
[[puzzle_info]]:
Line1: "Mars_Lander Easy <<Conditions>>"
Line2: "The_Descent Easy Loops"
Line3: "Temperatures Easy <<Conditions>>/Loops/Arrays"

[[Answers]]:
Line1: <<"{{Mars Lander}}">>
Line2: <<"{{Temperatures}}">>
```

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
<<BACKGROUND>>:

@<<Andriamanitra>>, a fellow CodinGamer, has created a great tool for finding the name of any approved/pending clash in the CodinGame database.

You can find his profile page here:
{{https://www.codingame.com/profile/8931375f2caabaa3c46fc9401a856edf4653983}}

You can find his tool here:
{{https://codingame.tools}}

data.stubGenerator:
read keyword:string(20)
read n:int

loop n read puzzleInfo:string(100)

write NO RESULTS MATCH THIS SEARCH.
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string, [[keyword]], representing the search-word.
<<Line 2:>> An integer, [[n]], for the number of puzzles in the CG database.
<<Next [[n]] Lines:>> A string, [[puzzle_info]], containing three space-separated elements: [[name]], [[difficulty]] and [[tags]].
data.outputDescription: <<[[?]] Lines:>> A string, [[name]], the name of the puzzle that matches the search-word. <<Any underscores present should be replaced with white-spaces>>. If there are no matches, output <<"{{NO RESULTS MATCH THIS SEARCH.}}">>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have taken inspiration from a fellow CodinGamer's work (See Background at bottom of the statement) and want to contribute in a similar manner.

You will be given n lines of strings, puzzle_info, that are in the CodinGame Puzzle database.

Each puzzle_info consists of three space-separated elements which follow this format:

puzzle_info = "name difficulty tags"

Any white-spaces in name, will be represented by underscores _.
There can be multiple tags in tags... if this is the case then they will be separated by slashes /.
All three elements will have a value, there will never be a blank value in puzzle_info.

You will also be given a search-word, keyword. You must find any relevant puzzles that include keyword somewhere in puzzle_info, and output their names in the order they appeared, with the underscores changed to white-spaces. The keyword is case-sensitive.

If there are no puzzles that match the keyword, then you must output "NO RESULTS MATCH THIS SEARCH.".


EXAMPLE:

n = 3
keyword = "Conditions"
puzzle_info:
Line1: "Mars_Lander Easy Conditions"
Line2: "The_Descent Easy Loops"
Line3: "Temperatures Easy Conditions/Loops/Arrays"

Answers:
Line1: "Mars Lander"
Line2: "Temperatures"


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
BACKGROUND:

@Andriamanitra, a fellow CodinGamer, has created a great tool for finding the name of any approved/pending clash in the CodinGame database.

You can find his profile page here:
https://www.codingame.com/profile/8931375f2caabaa3c46fc9401a856edf4653983

You can find his tool here:
https://codingame.tools




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A string, keyword, representing the search-word.
Line 2: An integer, n, for the number of puzzles in the CG database.
Next n Lines: A string, puzzle_info, containing three space-separated elements: name, difficulty and tags.

   

   

      
Output

      
? Lines: A string, name, the name of the puzzle that matches the search-word. Any underscores present should be replaced with white-spaces. If there are no matches, output "NO RESULTS MATCH THIS SEARCH.".

   

   

      
Constraints

      
0 < (Length of keyword) <= 25
0 < n < 55
0 < (Total # of characters in puzzle_info) <= 250

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
Loops
10
MARS_LANDER Easy Conditions
POWER_OF_THOR Easy Conditions
TEMPERATURES Easy Conditions/Loops/Arrays
ONBOARDING Easy Conditions
HORSE-RACING_DUALS Easy Loops
THE_DESCENT Easy Loops
MIME_TYPE Easy Strings/Hash_tables/Loops/Conditions
DEFIBRILLATORS Easy Loops/Distances/Trigonometry
ASCII_ART Easy Strings/Arrays/Loops
UNARY Easy Strings/Encoding/Loops/Conditions

         

         

            
Output

            
TEMPERATURES
HORSE-RACING DUALS
THE DESCENT
MIME TYPE
DEFIBRILLATORS
ASCII ART
UNARY
